*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Ahumada, May 8, 1826. Acknowledging receipt of order of May 4, and giving reasons for carrying out previous plans for war on the Wacoes, Tahuacanos, and Tahuiasea */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*My communication of the *date_mentioned n="04-30-1826">30th of last April*/date_mentioned*, informed you of my preparations for an attack upon the *person_mentioned*Waco*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Tahuacano */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Tahuiase*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*villages*/location_mentioned*. All my arrangements were made for the *date_mentioned n="05-25-1826">25th of this month*/date_mentioned*; the concentration of the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*was to take place at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*James Cortes*/person_mentioned*' house*/location_mentioned*, at the *location_mentioned*crossing of the San Antonio road*/location_mentioned* on the *location_mentioned*Brazos*/location_mentioned*, on the *date_mentioned n="05-17-1826">17th Instant*/date_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*Cherokee Indians */person_mentioned*had been directed to attack the *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Tahuacano */person_mentioned*village*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*on the head waters of the Navasota, about ten leagues East of the other villages*/location_mentioned*; the best spirit prevailed among the *person_mentioned*militia*/person_mentioned*. The above arrangements were made pursuant to your communication of the *date_mentioned n="04-10-1826">10th of April*/date_mentioned*, when, *date_mentioned n="05-08-1826">today*/date_mentioned*, at 12 o'clock, I received your reserved [reservado'] communication of the *date_mentioned n="05-04-1826">4th Instant*/date_mentioned*, in which you order me to suspend any hostile movements against the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*for the present; and to send you, by the return
of the *person_mentioned*Express */person_mentioned*a statement of the force at my disposal for an *person_mentioned*expedition */person_mentioned*; and, also, to appoint a place where I could meet you, your intentions being to take the field with 250 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in the month of *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1826">July*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*In consequence of this order, I sent, at 3 o'clock P. M. an express to the *person_mentioned*Cherokees */person_mentioned*to suspend their operations, alleging a hope of a treaty of peace between the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*Colonists*/person_mentioned*, in order to conceal the true motive; stating to them at the same time, that they must remain in readiness to march at the earliest notice, in case the peace could not be affected. I had already written my orders to the *person_mentioned*Captains of Militia*/person_mentioned*, informing them that the contemplated expedition was suspended in consequence of some hope of peace, which I did, to give a reason for the counterorder without exposing the true motive; but previous to these orders leaving my office, I received, at 6. o'clock P. M. by *person_mentioned*express */person_mentioned*a note from *person_mentioned*Captain Sims*/person_mentioned* of the *person_mentioned*Company of Militia of the *location_mentioned*Brazos*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*District of Bravo*/location_mentioned*, near the *location_mentioned*road to Bexar*/location_mentioned*, informing me that while he was executing my orders to explore a *location_mentioned*covered road*/location_mentioned* to the *location_mentioned*Indian Villages*/location_mentioned*, along the *location_mentioned*bottom of the river*/location_mentioned*, to avoid being noticed on a march through *location_mentioned*prairie lands*/location_mentioned*, he discovered, at about *location_mentioned*twenty five leagues above the road to Bexar*/location_mentioned*, trails of mounted *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, and a party on foot, leading to the *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned*. He returned at once to give information. I doubt not but a *person_mentioned*party */person_mentioned*left their *location_mentioned*villages */location_mentioned*to attack us, and our *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*are so scattered that it is difficult to determine upon what point they will fall first. I have already transmitted orders in every direction to send out *person_mentioned*spies*/person_mentioned*. In consequence of this notice I have thought it highly important not to communicate your order to suspend any hostile movements against the *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, because the *person_mentioned*Militia */person_mentioned*are now ready to march to the *location_mentioned*villages*/location_mentioned*, and I think, that if we are so fortunate as to discover the party that came to attack us, it would be advisable, after having routed them, to proceed by forced marches to their *location_mentioned*villages*/location_mentioned*, and to fall on them before they had recovered from the terror inseparable from defeat. I hope these circumstances will be considered a sufficient excuse for my not suspending hostile movements as you order me to do.*/p*
*p*If the occurrences above alluded to do not compel me to march to the *location_mentioned*Indian Villages*/location_mentioned*, I shall defer the *person_mentioned*expedition */person_mentioned*agreeably to your orders, in which event, I think we ought to meet at the *location_mentioned*crossing of the road to Bexar*/location_mentioned*, on the *date_mentioned n="06-27-1826">27th of June*/date_mentioned*, so as to attack the *location_mentioned*villages */location_mentioned*by the *date_mentioned n="07-04-1826">4th of July*/date_mentioned*. Thus time would be afforded me to call on the *person_mentioned*Militia of *location_mentioned*Trinity */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*,*/person_mentioned* the *person_mentioned*Cherokee */person_mentioned*and other *person_mentioned*tribes*/person_mentioned* in that section of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. In the meantime I shall take every step, my situation permits, to ascertain the movements of the *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, etc. The number of *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in this *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*on whom I can depend is from 175 to 200; 100 *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, I believe may be expected from the *location_mentioned*Trinity */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*; and, perhaps, 100 *person_mentioned*Cherokees*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Shawnees*/person_mentioned* and other trusty tribes of that section of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*; provided you think proper to give orders to these *person_mentioned*tribes */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*to join us in the contemplated expedition*/p*
*p*The above is in answer to your reserved communication.*/p*
*p*God and Liberty.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="05-08-1826">May 8th, 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
